events.name: API Roulette Hackathon
events.description:
Zurich GTUG is proud to present the API Roulette Hackathon. The event will take place at the Googleplex in Zurich.

Description of the event

Everyone participating in the Hackathon will select 1 API which they are interested in. Participants then form a team of no more than 3 members for the chosen API. One the teams are created each team will then spin the API Roulette wheel to select the second API.

With these two APIs the team has to create an Android Application, Web Site, or Web App combining the selected APIs.

For those not hacking in the Hackathon we will also have interesting presentations about the various API's.

Time

23rd August 18:30 - open end

Agenda

18:30 API Roulette & Team Building 19:00 Happy Hacking

Signup for the event here Zurich GTUG Registration

events.name: JSZurich - Sencha Touch
events.description:
Sencha Touch

As smartphones gain more market share, the demand for mobile applications rises. Creating these applications requires a deep knowledge of their respective platforms.

But there is hope! With the rise of mobile web frameworks, it becomes possible to build mobile applications using web technology! This opens the app market to web developers.

In this talk, @igorwesome will introduce you to the Sencha Touch mobile app framework.

events.name: Geneva ScrumBeer
events.location: Pub Lord Jim, Rue de Lausanne 32, 1201 Genève
events.description:
Proposed by Silvana Wasitova and Alexandre Cuva.

If you are a Lean/Agilist come and share your experience and your thoughts with the rest of us! Tell us about what happened to you.

If you are new to Scrum, XP, Lean, ... you are more than welcome as well. Come and have a drink with us. Meeting people is the funniest way to learn about something new!

Let's come together for a beer or two at the Pub "Lord Jim" near the Geneva train station.

events.name: IBM developerWorks - IBM Cognos Business Intelligence Workshop
events.description:
Learn about IBM Cognos 10 in this workshop. Get a high level overview of all the components through lectures and hands-on exercises. During the workshop, you will: Get an overview of IBM Smarter Planet and Business Analytics Get an overview of the Cognos 10 portfolio and its capabilities Use Cognos tools to create dashboards, dynamic reports and disconnected reports, and to conduct analysis and data exploration Understand various integration points Build a metadata foundation to fit business analysts and business intelligence needs Explore Cognos administration tasks and preview migration tasks from Cognos 8 to Cognos 10

Event highlights Cognos architecture and major components of Cognos Business Intelligence Cognos 10 and corporate performance management offering Tools apply to which business reporting needs to perform efficient business intelligence and performance management

Prerequisites: Knowledge of Cognos is not required.

events.name: Drupal Commerce Camp
events.location: Fachhochschule Luzern - Technik & Architektur, Technikumstrasse 21, 6048 Horw
events.description:
Am 2., 3. und 4. September 2011 findet in der Schweiz in Luzern das erste Drupal Commerce Camp statt. Der dreitägige Anlass zeigt Einsatzmöglichkeiten von Drupal für moderne Unternehmen. Frisch und informativ wie ein Drupal Camp, wendet es sich aber nicht nur an Entwickler und Anwender aus der Drupal Community, sondern an Geschäftsführer, Manager und Projektverantwortliche aus Agenturen, Medienhäusern, NGOs und Unternehmen. Der Anlass wird vom Verein Drupal Events durchgeführt und für die Räumlichkeiten haben wir die Fachhochschule Luzern als Partner gewinnen können.

Mehr Infos gibt es auf der offiziellen Seite des Drupal Commerce Camp.

events.name: PrestaApéro à Martigny (Sharing expertise in Prestashop)
events.location: Marché Restaurant Martigny,Relais du St. Bernard A9, 1920 Martigny
events.description: A travers cet apéro Prestashop, l'idée est de partager des informations concernant la solution e-commerce Prestashop. Tout le monde peut-y participer, e-commerçant, agence web, freelance, développeur, intégrateur, intéressé etc.. N'hésitez pas à vous inscrire, vous pourrez bénéficier d'avis professionnels et vous échanger des conseils qui pourront vous aider dans votre activité e-commerce.

events.name: IBM developerWorks - IBM WebSphere ILOG JRules 7 Business Rule Management Systems workshop
events.description: This 2-day no-charge, instructor-led workshop introduces the IBM WebSphere ILOG JRules 7 Business Rule Management System. It will provide a high level overview of all components in ILOG JRules 7 (covering the developer and business users tools). Attendees will work directly with ILOG JRules 7 components through hands-on exercises. You can learn about ILOG JRules architecture and experience all the major tools in the suite: Rule Studio, Rule Team Server, Rule Solution for Office, and Decision Validation Services. After completion of this workshop, you should have a good understanding of the ILOG JRules offering and understand benefits of ILOG Business Rules technologies. You will be able to identify tools that apply to specific profile of users and determine the rule integration that fits their requirements. This workshop is intended for new clients, existing clients and IBM Business Partners who want to learn about the ILOG JRules 7 Business Rule Management System and how it fulfills the IBM portfolio. The audience could include directors, managers, business analysts, IT architects and IT specialists. No particular knowledge of ILOG JRules is required. Event highlights ILOG JRules key features, benefits and architecture Hands-on exercises that let you practice using the tools Building a complete business rule application

events.name: Internet Briefing: Frontend Performance Optimierungen
events.description:
Für Mitglieder gratis, Gäste bezahlen Fr. 80.- für den Vortrag, Konsumation extra

Frontend Performance Optimierungen

Die ganzen Web Frameworks und CMS werden immer schneller und besser. Und das ist gut. Jedoch ist die Geschwindigkeit, mit der wir ein HTML ausliefern relativ unwichtig damit unsere Seiten im Browser schnell angezeigt werden. In diesem Vortrag werden wir kurz anschauen wie wichtig die Geschwindigkeit einer Seite wirklich ist. Anschliessend schauen wir uns kurz an wie das HTTP Protokoll genau funktioniert, gefolgt von 14 Punkten, die es uns leicht machen, unsere Seiten schneller auszuliefern:

  • Anzahl der HTTP Request minimieren
  • Die Wichtigkeit von CDNs
  • Expires Header
  • Komponenten GZipen
  • CSS gehören nach oben
  • JavaScript gehört nach unten
  • Bite kein CSS expressions
  • Kein inline JS und CSS, oder?
  • Wehnig DNS lookups * Minimieren von JavaScript
  • Weg mit den Redirects
  • Weg mit den doppelten Scripts
  • ETags konfiguration
  • Ajax Cachen

events.name: Workshop: Electronics for Beginners
events.description:
Little electronic initiation through simple evening projects:

  • Measure temperature
  • Use a buzzer
  • Blink LEDs
  • Detect brightness

We will be using the "Arduino Starter Kit" from Sparkfun.com.

Grouping for buying kits is encouraged (2 people for 1 kit is perfect)

events.name: Landscape of User Experience in Switzerland (LUXS)
events.description:
The Landscape of User Experience in Switzerland (LUXS) 2011 is an untraditional networking event organized jointly by the University of Zurich and the SI Software Ergonomics that aims to bridge the academic and industry UX communities in Switzerland.

More information: http://cms.uzh.ch/lenya/ifi/live/departments/zpac/luxs2011.html

events.name: Frontend Conference Zurich
events.description: Two days of inspiring talks on frontend and ux technologies

events.name: .NET UG Bern - Das Agile Development Framework (ADF) mit Golo Roden
events.description: Am Montag, den 12. September 2011 wird uns Golo Roden durch das Thema "Das Agile Development Framework (ADF)" führen. Doch bevor wir mit den Thema beginnen, wird uns Stefan einen Überblick in die Kinect-Programmierung geben.

events.name: Lean Agile Scrum Konferenz 2011
events.description: Die Fachgruppe Lean, Agile und Scrum der SwissICT ist stolz, die LAS Konference am 14.09.2011 in Zürich anzukündigen.

events.name: Zertifikatskurs Certified Spring Professional 2011
events.description: Puzzle ITC führt auch im 2011 wieder einen Zertifikatskurs zum Certified Spring Professional durch. In diesem viertägigen Training von SpringSource lernen Sie das Spring Open Source Framework so zu nutzen, dass Sie Geschäftsanwendungen künftig effizienter entwickeln.

events.name: IBM DB2 workshop for Oracle professionals
events.description:
Designed especially for Oracle professionals, this two-day session covers the Oracle compatibility features in IBM DB2 9.7 and includes a demonstration of the migration process to DB2. This workshop also compares Oracle and DB2 technologies to help you understand the similarities and differences. Through this workshop, you can build skills and become certified on IBM DB2 for Linux, UNIX, and Windows. In fact, you may discover that your Oracle and PL/SQL knowledge can make it easy to extend your skills to DB2. This workshop is based on new features in IBM DB2 that make it easy to: Leverage existing PL/SQL knowledge Migrate applications Reduce enablement costs Support an expanded set of vendor platforms Help lower the total cost of ownership At the end of the first day, attendees can take the "M45 IBM Information Management DB2 Technical Mastery Test" at no charge. Those who have successfully passed the M45 test are also encouraged to take the "730 DB2 9 Family Fundamentals Certification Exam" during the workshop at no charge. Note that the workshop and exams presume previous knowledge and experience with PL/SQL and Oracle databases.

Event highlights DB2 basics, focusing on similarities and differences of Oracle database DB2 tools DB2 autonomic features Storage compression Application enablement with Oracle database compatibility features Data concurrency Security

Prerequisites Basic knowledge of SQL and Oracle database product and administration tasks.

events.name: Internet Briefing: Sozialen Medien und Recht
events.description:
Für Mitglieder gratis, Gäste bezahlen Fr. 80.- für den Vortrag, Konsumationen extra

In den Sozialen Medien und schon fast im Gefängnis?

Die rechtlichen Vorgaben des Social Media Marketings haben oft nicht nur eine zivilrechtliche, sondern auch eine strafrechtliche Komponente. Angedroht werden Busse und Gefängnis, und zwar auch in Bereichen, wo man dies nicht unbedingt erwarten würde. Mit diesem Fokus zeigt Oliver Dos and Donts beim Publizieren und Werben in sozialen Medien auf. Untersucht werden unter anderem folgende Fragestellungen:

  • Wann liegt bei Werbekampagnen in sozialen Medien Spamming vor und was sind die Folgen davon? Sind Direct Messages Spam? Wie sieht es beim Posten auf Pinwänden aus?
  • Dürfen im Rahmen von sozialen Netzwerken erlangte Adressen für beliebige weitere Werbezwecke verwendet werden? Wann ist dies besonders heikel? Wie ist mit Auskunftsbegehren von Werbeempfängern umzugehen?
  • Wann dürfen fremde Texte, Grafiken, Fotos oder Videos in eigene Werbekampagnen eingebaut werden? Wie reagiert man auf Abmahnschreiben?
  • Wann liegen Persönlichkeitsverletzungen wie Rufschädigungen etc. vor? Kann das Anklicken des Like-Buttons eine Rufschädigung darstellen? Wie geht man bei Persönlichkeitsverletzungen vor?
  • Wie stellt ein Unternehmen sicher, dass sich seine Arbeitnehmer in sozialen Medien korrekt verhalten? Sind Social Media Guidelines zweckmässig? Wann haftet ein Unternehmen für das Verhalten seiner Arbeitnehmer?

events.name: OWASP Switzerland Meeting
events.description:
No presentation and location fixed yet but it will be awesome as usual :)

If you'd like to offer a meeting space (normally we have around 20 attendees) or a presentation/workshop, contact Sven (contact info can be found at http://disenchant.ch).

events.name: DEFCON Beer on Tuesday
events.description: Monthly Beer on Tuesday. The entry is next to the Second Hand CD Shop.

events.name: DB2 performance tuning and monitoring clinic
events.description:
This clinic is a series of distinctly focused presentations and labs with how-tos and best practices. It is for IBM Business Partners and customers. You can learn how to maintain a healthy and robust DB2 based information management system. Attend this event and discover: How to gather critical system resource information Best practices for database design How to start with a strong foundation using good configurations for optimal performance How to configure and use new monitoring Table Functions and event monitors Performance metrics to monitor and collection methods Monitoring interfaces and tools that are available with your DB2 installation How to diagnose DB2 activities that may be causing system bottlenecks How to find and identify locking issues How to improve concurrency with new currently committed isolation level How to capture and tune SQL queries Best practices for performance enhancing utilities (runstats and reorg) How to mitigate the impact of utilities, like backup, reorg, and runstats on your database system

Event highlights Introduction to new monitoring framework and other performance enhancing features included with DB2 9.7 Hands-on interactive labs to configure, monitor, and tune DB2 How to diagnose performance problems related to system bottlenecks, associate bottlenecks to related DB2 activities, and tuning solutions

Prerequisites Attendees must have an intermediate understanding of database management systems and their common components, preferably DB2. Prior participation in DB2 9.7 boot camp is recommended.

events.name: Berner Architekten Treffen: Jubiläumsanlass
events.description:
Obligatorische Anmeldung auf der BAT Homepage.

Jubiläumsanlass mit einem eingeladenen Referenten

Die Präsentationen sind noch nicht fixiert.

Wir freuen uns auf interessante Diskussionen und anregende Gespräche.
